description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
The Mozambique Strategic Information Program (M-SIP) project supports goals and objectives of the PEPFAR AIDS Free Generation’s Strategic Information goal as well as GOM’s HIV Acceleration Plan goal to improve data quality and use of HIV data. The M-SIP project works at a national level and in every province of Mozambique. Activities will target data quality of reported PEPFAR clinical and commu Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.8: Orphans and Vulnerable Children. Activities are aimed at improving the lives of orphans and other vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV/AIDS, and doing so in a measurable way. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. objectives

The Mozambique Strategic Information Program (M-SIP) project supports goals and objectives of the PEPFAR AIDS Free Generation’s Strategic Information goal as well as GOM’s HIV Acceleration Plan goal to improve data quality and use of HIV data. The M-SIP project works at a national level and in every province of Mozambique. Activities will target data quality of reported PEPFAR clinical and community indicators through a standardized Data Quality Auditing (DQA) intervention. Strategies for this mechanism to become more cost efficient over time include joint DQA visits with central, provincial and district level health professionals in addition to training and technical support. The monitoring and evaluation plan for these activities includes benchmark deliverables measured at specified delivery dates set by USG Mozambique, including completion of # DQAs per province per indicator and training/supervision visits completed. Reporting will occur quarterly or more frequently.

participating-org.narrative: JSI Research And Training Institute, INC.

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

mailing-address.narrative: 2100 Pennsylvania Avenue, Suite 200, Washington, DC 20522, USA

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.

title.narrative: Annual Reports to Congress on the President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief

Audit of the Department of State’s Coordination and Oversight of the U.S. President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief
